page.title: 08Ponteland CARE Activities
page.content: The idea is to simulate as near a normal life as can be achieved,a wide range of useful & productive activity is an essential part of the way of life.For example there is the establishment of market gardening and horticulture,where the end product is used primarily in the village and the surplus sold.Woodworking shops have also been established producing a wide range of wooden toys,garden furniture, beds etc which have both a theraputic effect to residents & are marketable. It is CARES philosophy that there should be an end product to whatever activity is attempted.Villagers also assist in the normal domestic chores of running a house being involved in the kitchens & food preparation for the village,laundry & housework. On the social side there are visits to local towns,villages,theatres etc.
